description: Borrowed from French naïve, feminine form of naïf, from Latin nativus (“native, natural”). Doublet of native.

adjectives.description: naive (comparative more naive, superlative most naive)

entries.meaning: Lacking worldly experience, wisdom, or judgement; unsophisticated.
Not having been exposed to something.
examples: Animals entering shelters are either (a) immunologically naïve and susceptible to infection and development of disease if exposed to pathogens; (b) already immune  […]

entries.meaning: (of art) Produced in a simple, childlike style, deliberately rejecting sophisticated techniques.
(computing) Intuitive; designed to follow the way ordinary people approach a problem.
